Update README.md
Update README.md
Suppresses error reported in Issue #27
Switching to native for loops because they're orders of magnitude faster.
Successfully passes basic JSHint debugging. http://jshint.com/
Adding basic support for inline <style> elements.
Generated output.
Version bump.
Throttling resize event to be nicer to IE9.
Version bump.
Generated output.
Flooring the halved values. Flexie tests once again passing under all supported browsers (sans Firefox).
The floatDropFix was the cause of IE9's hang problems. I believe enough tweaks, coupled with the upcoming Math.floor fix is enough to remove the potentially dangerous workaround.
Suppressing @media query error, though I make no effort to understand the query itself.
Updating Selectivizr bits.
Attempt to fix rare edge case where flex properties are defined but elements are not found in DOM.
Version bump.

fix a crash when a "box-flex: 1;" in the css is not used in a page.
Via https://github.com/fredb219/flexie/commit/f60b74870bbb672b384998696896df542413eac7
Release 1.0.0
Flexie updates.
Only apply to IE8 since it's the only one with a problem.
Flexie updates.
Dealing with more clearfix issues.
Avoiding infinite looping.
Adding conditionals for block-axis, inline-axis.
Flexie updates.
Adding a bit on why YUI is not working with Flexie.
Complete rewrite of the attachLoadMethod function. All supported engines are now attaching per their respective methods. Those that do not have a DOMContentLoaded method fallback to an onload method.
Merging both engine trees.
Flexie updates.
Updating language.
Returning the Flexie instance.
Flexie updates.

Opera doesn't like a few things about the new generated rules. The reason this has been so difficult is that the standard clearfix with 0 height doesn't work well in IE8:
	- Opera doesn't do the \0020 content hack. I've reverted back to an empty string because this works fine in IE8.
	- It also has issues with the height: 1px, width: 0 workaround. The clearfix fails unless the width spans the length of the cleared element.
	- Having a width of 100% and a height of 1px creates extra space, which invokes scrollbars if applied to the body element.

So after all is said and done, the width/height values need to be branched for IE and Opera.
Flexie updates.
Making sure some of the conditionals in the partial support check only apply to Webkit browsers.
API correction.
Flexie updates.
Fixing Closure Compiler warnings.
Flexie updates.
Adding paddingFix for IE9.
IE8 was collapsing floats with the previous rules. Took a lot of experimenting, but this setup seems to work great.
Adding float drop caveat.
Being more explicit in setting FLX_DOM_ID expando.
Removing horizontal orient fix.
Adding a global variable for data-flexie-parent
String replacement.
Instead of joining the selectors, I'm creating a multi-target selector, then eventually splitting the selector up and looping through it in the boxModel method.
Only apply fix if box-orient is horizontal.
Don't ignore properties that don't exist. Append them to the existing box object for parsing.
If match exist and is a child node, add the shortProp to the object.
Making sure returned result is an array.
Adding snazzy Still Maintained Badge.
Updated Google Closure Compiler.
Documenting the complete API.
Documenting the complete API.
Documenting the complete API.
Documenting the complete API.
Documenting the complete API.
Documenting the complete API.
Documenting the complete API.
Flexie updates.
Adding a basic demo. More robust examples found on the website.

A pretty intense rewrite of the selector parse engine. Discovered that I was not accounting for CSS selectors with multiple targets, i.e. #foo, #bar, #biz.

While I was handling multiple child values, I've rewritten the parser to handle both parent and child selectors.
README update.
Updating .gitignore.
Adding minified Flexie version for distribution.
JSLint compliancy edits.
Turns out both IE6 & 7 like explicit zoom values.
Switching to GCC's SIMPLE_OPTIMIZATIONS flag, which means these declarations are no longer needed.
Hoping this extra instantiation call is no longer needed.
For IE6, it likes an explicitly declared zoom value.
Adding some browser considerations.
Storing the current instance for use in updateInstance method.
Adding a hasFlex value for use with floatDropFix function.
The float drop fix only needs to be run once. Was erroneously running it after each flex loop.

Overhauled the floatDropFix method:

- The while loop was a bit convoluted. It only needs to loop while:
	- The first child's top offset is not equal to the last child's top offset.
- It was also performing a while loop inside a for each loop, as opposed to vice versa.
- The while loop now tests if the child nodes contain a flex value. If so, it targets elements with flex above other nodes.
No, it's not. Sorry.
Fixing syntax error.
Merging the two methods I previously had of keeping track of Flexie objects. Removing FLEX_INSTANCES and using FLEX_BOXES instead.
String replacement.

IE6 doesn't understand adjacent and child selectors. That's fine. BUT WHY DOES IT NEED TO BLOW UP JUST BY DECLARING THAT RULE?!

Ahem. Sorry. This fix strips those selectors from the rule. It won't keep the fidelity of the rule, but that's the price to pay for IE6 support.
Compile with SIMPLE_OPTIMIZATIONS
Abstracting the setting of FLX_DOM_ID.
Syntax error in insertRule call.
Removing superfluous floatType variable.
The double float margin bug fix in boxOrient makes this bug fix obsolete.
Found a race condition where match was undefined.
Updating syntax.
Adding asynchronous API information.
Adding a method to build a selector based on available data.
I was apparently not paying attention here. Wow. Properties should be applied to params, not target. Also correcting sanitizeChildren parameters.
Extraneous variable.
Targeting wrong variable.
possibleChildren can now be either a predefined object or defined child nodes.
Prepping Flexie to handle instantiation without style sheets.
Adding a method to manipulate child node flex/ordinal-group values.
Can't return false here because there are other instances to update.
Whoops, was unnecessarily nesting child node loops.
Adding IE6 double float margin fix.
Merging addRule methods into one for IE 6 & 7.
Adding missing semicolon.
IE7 no longer needs the collapsing margin fix.
I suspect that the 0.1px padding fix has messed with my box-pack calculations. If I apply the previously horizontal-only fix *and* remove the vertical-only fix, I get the correct layout.
Spelling error.
The floatDropFix is back for boxPack method, but now only applies under strict conditions.
A bit overzealous on matching DOM nodes. Checking FLX_DOM_ID prevents me from creating on-the-fly Flexie items. Might need to revisit this to figure out a different fix.
IE collapsable margin hack no longer needed due to 0.1px padding fix.
Now using updateInstance API to properly update an existing Flexie-enabled flexbox node.
Adding an external getInstance API method.
Updating internal API.

More complex conditional for boxAlignStretch support:

IF no total flex value
	OR no nested flex children
AND
IF not a child itself of a flex box
	OR no total flex value
THEN

apply.
Returning an object to check nest value and total flex value.
Once again preventing organizeChildren from applying if array only has one object.

The padding fix was clobbering any preset padding. Addressing this issue twofold:

- A padding-top value of 0.1px is just as effective as padding: 0.1px 0 0
- Checking for preset padding first, then using the padding fix.
Hm. Apparently there are instances of the bubbleUp method needing to continue even if no FLX_DOM_ID is found.
Check if target has dimension (width/height) values to deal with box-alignment issues.
Passing properties along for later use.
For partially supported browsers, don't apply fixes if any parent has a flex value (since they perform to spec in these cases).
Resolves a scenario where box-flex and box-ordinal-group are used in tandem. Storing both values so they don't clobber each other.
Apparently, adjacent/descendant CSS selectors are worth nothing in specificity terms. TIL.
Prefixing parent attribute flag to stay in HTML5 data namespace.
The 0.1px padding fix has made this fix obsolete.
boxAlignStretch gets a rewrite to better deal with padding values.
adding sanitizeChildren call to clean out children before each call.
Accidentally doubled up on this parameter.
Whitespace.
Moving boxOrdinalGroup above boxFlex in method chain and streamlining.
box-ordinal-group should always include children even if they don't have an ordinal value.
No need to continue looping if immediate parent does not contain an identifier.
Ran into scenarios where these values didn't match up. Fortunately FLX_DOM_ID will always match.
Removing unnecessary float stripping.
Replacing strings with global variables.
Adding default values for properties to ensure some form of layout is applied.
box-align positioning wasn't happening. Somehow this eluded me.
Adding a padding fix which helps squelch the overflow issues.
Serve compliant browsers their correct float value.
box-direction is inheritable. We need to see if there are any nested flexbox elements.
Avoiding having to loop through the FLEX_BOXES global in certain instances.
Adding a hook to be able to grab child flexbox elements.
Making global INHERIT variable.
Adding new sanitizeChildren method.
Making index parameter optional.
Adding a method to filter out CSS duplicates.
Moving CSS_SELECTOR parser to global scope.
Making sure margin is not less than zero.
Sanity check for UNDEFINED status.
Fixing a bug where bubbling up the DOM was stripping away preset width/height properties. Adding a cleanPositioningProperties method which only remove positioning and avoids dimensions.
Fixing a bug with incrementing FLX_DOM_ID
Once I'm done parsing properties, I can't rely on the parse order to apply flex properties. It needs to be based on DOM order.
Don't apply partialSupport fixes if box-flex is in effect.
Tidying README.
Bubble up method is back to deal with flexbox positioning regressions.
Updating README.
Adding Caveats section.
Add target margins only if box-orient: horizontal.
Abstracting variable name. newWidth -> newDimension.
Reverse loop through ordinal properties if box-direction is reverse.
floatDropFix should only apply when elements are floated (i.e., box-orient: horizontal)
Quite horrifyingly, I was removing all text-node children from the DOM, instead of just empty text nodes. Yikes.
Bingo. Moving the boxFlex method before the boxAlign method resolves the flexbox layout issues *and* avoids having to rubber-band up and down the DOM.
Switching to this method allows IE8 to pass unit test suite, while still maintaining correct layout on fringe tests.
Sanity check for IE.

The nested flexbox bug rears its head again. This should hopefully fix the issues. Essentially, a problem arises when doing dimension calculations. As I bubble down and apply flexbox values, I'm changing each flexbox width/height, etc.

The end result therefore might be a flexbox layout where an inordinate amount of whitespace exists. This can't simply be fixed by bubbling up the DOM, because the same issue would still remain, only backwards.

The fix is to (unfortunately), rubber-band both down the DOM, and back up. This is expensive, but necessary for flexbox layouts.

So I'm introducing a bubbleUp method, which checks each parent for existence of an element with a FLX_DOM_ID expando. If found, it re-applies its flex properties.
Total dimension should include parent element margin offsets.
Total whitespace should not include child margin offsets.
Overzealous on this calculation. It should not subtract its parent's padding values.
Making sure a target value exists.

I realized that selectors with the same specificity value might not override each other based on their position in the style sheet. I'm correcting that by passing in the loop index to the specificity calculation. This ensures that all values will be different.
Exposing final group of flexboxes via FLEX_BOXES global.
Folding in changes to the Selectivizr engine. (https://twitter.com/keithclarkcouk/status/24477615930736640)
Adding specificity test to box-flex.

Adding a method to calculate CSS specificity based on selector. This will give me the true value of the selector and will allow me to apply child rules correctly. Note that !important is ignored, so if you rely on that, you're on your own.
IE throws an error if string is undefined.
Since child nodes can have several ordinal values (that may be overridden via CSS rule order), make sure we don't accidentally apply a lesser value to an ordinal group.
Reverting previous definedProperties fix. Turns out that wasn't the issue.
Ensuring property/value pairs get trimmed of whitespace.
Resolving bug where scope is lost after testing for existing properties.
Making sure to trim flex box properties. Ran into a bug where this was causing some selectors to fail.
Globalizing trim method.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:doctyper/flexie
Release 0.9.0
Release 0.9.0
Trimming initial padding on IE 6.
Release 0.8.0
Float drop fix is making IE hang.
IE collapsing margin fix should not affect IE 9 as it's working properly.
Adding test for box-align: stretch support (Webkit)
Adding test for box-pack: justify support (Firefox).
Restructuring flexboxSupport method to allow for more tests. Slight refactoring of appended test markup.
Abstracting partialSupport test to support other properties.
Adding two-way reversal between box-direction: reverse and normal.
Using appendPixelValue method instead of manipulating DOM directly.
Addresses collapsing margin in IE7 and below.
For IE 7 and below, the first child margin collapses if a target padding is found. This fix appends the margin value with the target padding value.
IE6 throws an error on fringe occasions.
Resolving error when page is narrow. Specs unclear on how to handle this scenario, however.
Release 0.7.0
Updating Readme to reference Webkit normalization.
Landing Webkit support for box-align: stretch.
Resolving IE8 collapsing margin fix.
box-ordinal-group should not apply if less than two matrix keys are present.

Apply position property to new first child if box-ordinal property is used. Fixes issue #4:

https://github.com/doctyper/flexie/issues#issue/4
IE dislikes using getComputedStyle on element dimension. Instead I grab the offset dimension and subtract padding/border.
Adding pixel suffix to be safe.
Removing old code.
Version bump.
Refactoring box-pack: justify method to comply with unit test results.
Deprecating box-pack: end conditional.
Updating center dimension calculations.
Dimension calculation should use computed widths/heights rather than offset dimensions.
Margins should not collapse on all elements after first child. Resolving a bug where the wrong node was being used to parse uncollapsed margin total.
Moving boxDirection before all other modification methods to comply with flexbox spec.
Merging float drop fix into one method. Resolving bug where an infinite loop would result due to differing margins between child elements.
Merging createMatchMatrix methods.
updateInstance method now works on either all nodes, or a specified node.
Adding float drop fix to boxPack method. Seems to work well.
Referencing live child nodes in case children are modified via box-ordinal-group.
Moving boxOrdinalGroup before boxFlex. Child position is critical to how flex is applied.
Adding link, formatting fixes.
Adding a method to destroy individual Flexie instances.
Resolving the occasional float drop that was occurring when box-flex was in effect.
Cleaning up variable assignments.
Resolving bug in box-pack: justify. Margin should not be applied on the first child node.
Adding opposite margin to dimension calculations.
Correcting earlier fix. Tested on Opera, but IE doesn't like computedStyle calculations here. Using an alternate method seems to work better.
Restructuring parameters to avoid unnecessary computations.
Fixing bug where whitespace calculation should exclude parent padding.
Adding UNDEFINED global variable.
Fixing bug where no default box-flex value was found.
Stricter property matching to avoid false positives. If no display property is present, match should not continue.
Filtering out script / style / link elements.
Caveat about the browser differences in flexbox.
Explaining why it may be a while before box-lines gets support.
Adding box-flex-group to list of supported properties.
Updating path references.
Comment cleanups.
Updating to latest versions.
Ignoring generated dist directory.
Adding Google Closure Compiler & YUI Compressor builds.

Adding rake tasks to build distributable files.
(via: https://github.com/madrobby/zepto/blob/master/Rakefile)
Moving Flexie to src directory.
Version bump!
Landing initial box-flex-group support.
JSLint compliance.
Comment cleanup.
Consistent naming patterns.
Cleaning up where Regular Expressions appear in the namespace.
More descriptive selectivizrEngine variable.
RegExp optimizations.

Exposing Flexie.flexboxSupported. Returns true if native flexbox is supported.
Exposing Flexie.version. Returns current Flexie version.
Privatizing Flexie.box.
Making updateInstances a public method, accessible via Flexie.updateInstances(). Useful for DOM modifications after render.
Optimizing RegExp. Adding references to new global objects.
Adding comments. Moving a string constant to global object.
Minor syntax tweaks.
Minor testing in Opera 10.0. Safe to assume compatibility with base version.
Optimism abounds.
Adding FLX_DOM_ID check to child nodes to prevent overrides and duplicates.

Much smarter algorithm to detect elements with multiple flexbox rules. Flexie now tests if the target DOM node is scheduled for handling. If so, it adds each property to an object associated with the DOM node. Flexie is called only after all styles are parsed.

Ref: https://github.com/doctyper/flexie/issues#issue/2
Sanity check for undefined property values.
Version bump!
Compression optimizations.

Adding real-world sample. Via http://hacks.mozilla.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/exemple-blog.html

Minimal changes to the sample. Mainly moving the inline styles to an external stylesheet (a Selectivizr requirement), and adding jQuery + Flexie at the bottom of the page.
Re-scoping value variable.

Where previously I was using display: box as the flexbox trigger, I've discovered that this would fail when combining multiple flexbox properties (i.e. http://infrequently.org/2009/08/css-3-progress/).

In that example, the .reverse class would fail to instantiate Flexie because there is no display: box hook associated with it.

Thus it's become necessary to look for *any* flexbox property, and initialize Flexie when found.
Value should be greater than max-* value.
Omitting specific elements from the stretch box-align value. Both Webkit and Gecko choose to ignore the property for form elements.
This may be an unnecessary dimension setting. It prevents IE6 from decreasing width/height. Once commented out nothing broke, so this may just be a relic of the pre box-flex Flexie.
IE9 Preview 6 supports both insertRule(!) and addRule(!), but throws an error once invoked(!!). I'm switching the order of the calls. Will need to revisit once IE9 goes gold.
Minification optimizations.
Suppressing IE9 warning. The call works, but IE9 Preview 6 throws an error regardless.
Unused variable.
Since we're eval'ing these properties, they were getting annihilated via minification.
Abstracting addLoadEvent to share functionality with resize listener.
GCC compression tweaks.
Removing unused child values.
Testing for max-* properties. If they exist, the element should not lose its positioning values.
Must uppercase the property before calling offset[prop]. Adding a check to make sure it returns 0 on a worse-case-scenario.
Optimizing calcPx function. Instead of appending a dummy node (expensive), now I calculate based on the existing element (bit less expensive).
IE7 gets sniffed out as well. Some weirdness with parsing rules it doesn't understand.
RegExp cleanup.
Test over. IE still sucks. Timeout back.
So that was dumb, and now I understand why the value is set on left :)
Remove delay to test IE.
Tweaking the clearfix rule to be less intrusive.
Updating RegExp.
Making the constructor loop standalone to be called from multiple places.
Tweaks to Dean Edward's computed style engine to prevent IE warnings. Also removing an unecessary parameter.
Flexie must initialize as quickly as possible, however it also needs to run one more time onload as soon as its initial calculations are complete. So I'm adding a load event handler.
Emphasis mine.
Adding box-ordinal-group to list of supported properties.
Reintroducing call to clear positioning value. The issue I was seeing was due to max-width, which is another interesting property I'll have to code around.
IE6 crashes when applying advanced selectors.
Delay for an instant because iE6 is insane.
Landing initial support for box-ordinal-group.
Moving flexbox property methods into their own namespace. This groups them up and allows me to iterate through the namespace instead of calling each method individually.
Adding ordinal-group sniffer to initial property tree parser.
Version bump!
Whitespace cleanup.
Passing global object to boxModel function.
Balance check no longer necessary after the switch to clearfix.
Using global TRUE variable.

Overflow for float clearing is out. There was too much overhead with trying to recalculate dimensions on resize. Also, a container could not have visible overflow, which goes against browser implementations.

So Plan B: PIE-Clearfix. It was a bit tricky to do this without the benefit of a stanalone stylesheet, but it should work across all IEs and Opera.
After switching to Array.reverse(), discovered that boxDirection was flipping the array reversal back and forth onresize. Adding a flag to only fire boxDirection once on render, but not on resize.
Leaving positioning as-is if only one flex child exists.
Any element displayed as box should be displayed block to calculate it's width and child widths. Very nervous about changing display, but this seems like the only alternative (unless, inline-block?)
Width/Height should never be below zero.
Correcting call to calculate pixels. I was passing in the wrong parameter.
Rooting out the getComputedStyle problem. The value being set needs to be an integer, and thus it was generating an error on "auto" or "medium" values.
Wasn't accounting for instances where no element was using flexbox.

Ignoring script/style/link elements. Found some instances where Flexie was treating these as child nodes.

Storing a "clean" child node array and using it as a reference instead of a live node list.
Using Array.reverse instead of manually looping through the array backwards.
Adding global references for compression benefits.
IE didn't like that I was forEach'ing document.styleSheets. Will investigate later.
Found a bug where I was never passing the intended property into the IE pixel engine. Confused about how I was still getting correct results...
Adding a forEach method which cleans up the code and reduces GCC compression size. Win-win-win.
Resetting any child properties before instantiating.
Accounting for parent padding.
"constructor" is reserved in Closure Compiler. Renaming so that it also gets minified.
We know ENGINE exists, but does it have a load function?
Storing the engine for later use.
Laying groundwork for unit testing. I'll have to comb through all possible flexbox property combinations to get to 1.0.
Version bump!
Using offset[Width/Height] yields more exact results.
Justify doesn't need a double-margin. Not sure why just yet, will need to do some additional investigating.
Vertical margins don't collapse(!!) in flexbox mode. Took me a good while to figure that one out.
Adding box-flex support for margins/paddings.
Adding box-align support for margins/paddings.
Adding global PADDING_* properties.
Adding box-pack support for margins/paddings.

Fine-tuning box-pack: justify support. Per the spec, the children should be spread evenly, with the first child flush left and the last child flush right. I've added some checks and balances to check for any overflow. If so, distribute the overflow amongst the children so that no pixel gaps exist on either first/last child, and no child gets knocked down to a second row.
offsetWidth is a much better way to detect total width size here.
Assigning correct borderRightWidth property.
Moving getParams up the ladder since it's now called earlier.
Stray whitespace.
Per the spec, all display: box support properties are optional. Flexie should not force a property to be present.
Creating a unique object for each child match. It was previously overriding the same selector and failing when multiple elements had the same flex value.
Expose public properties after Google's Closure Compiler is done optimizing.
Stop Google's Closure Compiler from complaining.
Avoiding hyphens in properties makes this function redundant.
Piggybacking on supported libraries for DOMContentLoaded event. Flexie will fallback to window.onload if none present (i.e. Sizzle).
Landing initial support for Opera (10.63).
Adding returnAsInt option to native getComputedStyle branch.
Opera is quirky about leading/trailing space, so we run the replace once again and do a sanity check as well.
Adding a trim function to consolidate the multiple replace functions.
Version bump!

Halving the margin value to fix the IE Double-float margin bug (it's been a while!)
http://www.positioniseverything.net/explorer/doubled-margin.html
Adding an IE version detector. Will come in handy in exactly one commit.
Sanity check for existence of target && child nodes.
Forgot to assign prop to the result.
Cribbing directly from jQuery, since they would know best :)
If matrix.total is zero, no child node has a flex value, and we can safely stop.
Creating standalone getTrueValue function.
Ignore negative values.

- Removing DOM Polling for now. It's way expensive and should be an opt-in in the future.
- Consolidating resize events into one. No reason to fire multiple resize listeners and cuts down on overhead.
Constructor requires the 'new' keyword.
Syntax changes via JSLint. Flexie should now pass "The Good Parts" test.
Adding Ready For Prime Time Status.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:doctyper/flexie
Adding Ready For Prime Time Status.
Adding Ready For Prime Time Status.
One var to rule them all.
Making sure to add a standalone rule for each selector in a multiple-selector rule (ex: #header, #footer {}). Previously only the last defined selector was being handled.
Removing unused cases.
Importing demo.css to test @import support.
Cleaning up demo styles.
Moving Flexie-specific functions outside the selectivizr scope.
Using upper-case globals for consistency.
Renaming to shorthand markdown format.
Weeding out a bug that was adding an undefined child to the array.
Ignoring call if no children found.
Making Flexie Closure Compiler compliant. Flexie now compiles error-free using the ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS flag. 3.25KB gzipped.
Updating the source tree. Moving demo files to demo directory. Moving Flexie to source root.
Syntax update.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:doctyper/flexie
Merge conflicts
Merge conflicts
Adding README.
Adding README.
Adding MIT License.
Using trim1 method (via: http://blog.stevenlevithan.com/archives/faster-trim-javascript)
Whitespace.
Switching to a more robust layout sample. (via: http://www.the-haystack.com/2010/01/23/css3-flexbox-part-1/)
Hm. Seems there's a spare bug in Selectivizr's parse engine.
Adding prototype model for allowing multiple flexbox layouts on a page.
Adding support for CSS-defined margins / borders.
Scoping i, j, k, l variables.
Whoops. Was accidentally leaking global variables.
Removing height fix for now.
Adding try/catch for fringe properties.
Adding DOM Polling / Resize Events to recalculate flexbox. Polling is was expensive though and should be used with caution. This may be an opt-in setting in the future.
doc variable was being redefined.
Adding more explicit test for document.defaultView
Scoping props variable. In certain cases it was leaking to the global property.
Increasing container block height.

Adding references to all Selectivizr-supported selector engines (bonus: all pass for Flexie :)

Adding a small function block to output the child node width for testing purposes.
Simplifying box-flex parser and grouping into function blocks. Should make code much easier to read.
Merging variables.

Adding global scope for SUPPORT and LIBRARY parameters. I'll have to pull determineSelectorMethod from the selectivizr scope block, but it makes more sense to test for flexbox support *and* presence of a selector engine before pulling down CSS via Ajax.
Hit a breaking point in flex evaluation. Committing while the old code exists.
Adding a parameter to return value as integer rather than text.
Testing properties.

Starting on box-flex child support. So far so good, I'm able to pass the flex value down to the child (will need testing on the various selector engines).

Now the hard part begins: actually adjusting the layout based on the box-flex value.
Cleaning up all previous loops/checks/balances. They now (mostly) share common properties.
Adding a helper function to avoid repetition.
Defining global dimensions / positioning / functions to help between all the different layout options.
Rudimentary support for vertical orient + align + pack + direction. Now to clean up my various switch trees...

Switching from scoped namespaces to scoped global function. Although it's not my preferred method, it generates better compression results via Google's Closure Compiler. Reduced overhead > preferred method.
Working on vertical box orientation support.
Since this call is now private, no need to retain exact API.
Removing old code.
Testing vertical orientation.
Flagging previously tested values with "+"
Test properties.
Removing test margins for now. I'll start with basic support and work from there.
Support for box-align stretch/start/end/center, box-pack start/end/center/justify
Adding shared utilities for client width/height.
IE9 false positive fix.
This commit maybe seals the deal on floats vs positioning. Changing DOM element order is probably not acceptable.
Adding .gitignore.
Inline-block is very unstable in older IE versions and barely functions in IE8. I will need to abandon its use. Attempting float-based layout as an alternative. Possible option: Absolute positioning.
No more need for external Flexie.box() calls. However, with the switch to auto CSS detection comes a dependency on an external selector library.

- Using Selectivizr's <http://selectivizr.com/> CSS parsing engine to auto-detect Flex Box Elements. No need for a separate Flexie call :)

- Currently it only matches the Flex Box parent. Will need to build support for Flex Box Children.

- Some issues around how to scope function. Will need to address in a later build.
Moving styles to external files.
Syncing CSS with Flexie parameters.
Adding box-direction support.
Testing edits.

Inline-block appears to work in IE8, but I've only tested limited support.

No clue what it will do when used for actual layout, but we'll find out soon.
Testing edits.
Starting with basic box-orient and box-align support. Perhaps inline-block will be of assistance.
Shelving the CSS-sniffing for now. Too complicated. Maybe I can piggyback on some other parse engine later.
Initial commit.
